text: In his call for a border wall, President Donald Trump said that the Democrats had turned to immigration after his election as President. Trump said: "Sen Chuck Schommer, who you will hear later tonight, has repeatedly supported a physical barrier in the past alongside many other Democrats." "They changed their mind only after I was elected president." This is the wrong description of the barrier that won the democratic support 13 years ago. More than half of the Democrats in the Senate voted in favour of the 2006 Security Act, which President George W. Bush signed into law, including the then Senate. Barack Obama, Chuck Schommer and Hillary Clinton. Most Democrats in the House of Representatives voted against it, including the Republic of Nancy Pelosi. The law authorized a fence about 700 miles from the United States-Mexico border. By 2015, US Customs and Border Protection had built 654 miles of fences, and the Government Accountability Bureau reported. The fence was different from the wall that Trump promised to build on the campaign track, which he said would be made of "hard concrete" 95 stories long with "very big and beautiful door."
